t: By*p the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down, yea, we wept, when we remembered Zion.
We*p hanged our harps upon the willows in the midst thereof.
For*p there they that carried us away captive required of us a song; and they that wasted us required of us mirth, saying, Sing us one of the songs of Zion.
How*p shall we sing the Lord's*s song in a strange land?
If*p I forget thee, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget her cunning.
If*p I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth; if I prefer not Jerusalem above my chief joy.
Remember,*p O Lord,*s the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem; who said, Rase it, rase it, even to the foundation thereof.
O*p daughter of Babylon, who art to be destroyed; happy shall he be, that rewardeth thee as thou hast served us.
Happy*p shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thy little ones against the stones.
